pandemic_simulator.environment.interfaces package¶

Submodules¶

pandemic_simulator.environment.interfaces.contact_tracer module¶

class pandemic_simulator.environment.interfaces.contact_tracer.ContactTracer[source]¶

Bases: abc.ABC

An interface for contact tracing apps.

abstract add_contacts(contacts: orderedset._orderedset.OrderedSet) → None[source]¶

Adds a trace of contacts obtained at a given time.

Parameters

contacts – Contacts to add.

abstract get_contacts(person_id: pandemic_simulator.environment.interfaces.ids.PersonID) → Mapping[pandemic_simulator.environment.interfaces.ids.PersonID, numpy.ndarray][source]¶

Get contacts

Parameters

person_id – Person’s id to trace.

Returns

Mapping from each contact’s id to a numpy array of floats between 0 and 1, representing

the contact hours scaled on a day (24 hours). The length of the sequence depends on the number of days for data conservation.

abstract new_time_slot() → None[source]¶

Adds a new time slot to the contact tracing (e.g., a new day, or a new hour, depending on the granularity).

abstract reset() → None[source]¶

Resets the traces.

class pandemic_simulator.environment.interfaces.infection_model.InfectionModel[source]¶

Bases: abc.ABC

Model of the spreading of the infection.

abstract needs_contacts(subject_infection_state: Optional[pandemic_simulator.environment.interfaces.infection_model.IndividualInfectionState]) → bool[source]¶

This method returns True if the current state needs contacts to be computed in order to step. :param subject_infection_state: Current state of the infection for the subject. If None, a base state is used.

abstract reset() → None[source]¶

Reset the infection model

abstract step(subject_infection_state: Optional[pandemic_simulator.environment.interfaces.infection_model.IndividualInfectionState], subject_age: int, subject_risk: pandemic_simulator.environment.interfaces.infection_model.Risk, infection_probability: float) → pandemic_simulator.environment.interfaces.infection_model.IndividualInfectionState[source]¶

This method implements the evolution model for the infection. :param subject_infection_state: Current state of the infection for the subject. If None, a base state is used. :param subject_age: Age of the subject. :param subject_risk: Health risk for the subject. :param infection_probability: Probability of getting infected.

Returns

New infection state of the subject.

class pandemic_simulator.environment.interfaces.location_states.ContactRate(min_assignees: int, min_assignees_visitors: int, min_visitors: int, fraction_assignees: float, fraction_assignees_visitors: float, fraction_visitors: float)[source]¶

Bases: object

Defines contact rates in a location.

fraction_assignees: float¶

A fraction of contacts between all assignees currently in the location. A value in [0, 1]

fraction_assignees_visitors: float¶

A fraction of contacts between assignees and visitors currently in the location. A value in [0, 1]

fraction_visitors: float¶

A fraction of contacts between all visitors currently in the location. A value in [0, 1]

min_assignees: int¶

Minimum number of contacts between assignees in the location

min_assignees_visitors: int¶

Minimum number of contacts between assignees and visitors in the location

min_visitors: int¶

Minimum number of contacts between visitors in the location

Bases: object

State of the location.

assignees: orderedset._orderedset.OrderedSet¶

A set of ids of persons assigned to the location. Default is an empty set where nobody is assigned.

assignees_in_location: orderedset._orderedset.OrderedSet¶

A set of ids of assignes who are currently in the location. Default is an empty set.

contact_rate: pandemic_simulator.environment.interfaces.location_states.ContactRate = ContactRate(min_assignees=1, min_assignees_visitors=1, min_visitors=0, fraction_assignees=0.5, fraction_assignees_visitors=0.0, fraction_visitors=0.0)¶

Rate at which assignees interact with other persons at that location.

is_open: bool¶

A boolean to indicate if the location is open or closed.

property persons_in_location¶

Property that returns the set of person ids in the location.

Returns

ID of the persons in the location.

social_gathering_event: bool = False¶

Set to True to advertise a social gathering at the location.

visitor_capacity: int = -1¶

Number of visitors allowed during the visitor_time

pandemic_simulator.environment.interfaces.pandemic_observation module¶

class pandemic_simulator.environment.interfaces.pandemic_observation.PandemicObservation(global_infection_summary: numpy.ndarray, global_testing_summary: numpy.ndarray, stage: numpy.ndarray, infection_above_threshold: numpy.ndarray, time_day: numpy.ndarray, unlocked_non_essential_business_locations: Optional[numpy.ndarray] = None)[source]¶

Bases: object

Dataclass that updates numpy arrays with information from PandemicSimState. Typically, this observation is used by the reinforcement learning interface.

classmethod create_empty(history_size: int = 1, num_non_essential_business: Optional[int] = None) → pandemic_simulator.environment.interfaces.pandemic_observation.PandemicObservation[source]¶

Creates an empty observation TNC layout array.

Parameters

  • history_size – Size of history. If set > 1, the observation can hold information from multiple sequences of PandemicSimStates.

  • num_non_essential_business – Number of non essential business locations.

Returns

an empty PandemicObservation instance

global_infection_summary: numpy.ndarray¶

stage: numpy.ndarray¶
time_day: numpy.ndarray¶

  • hist_index – history time index

pandemic_simulator.environment.interfaces.person_routine module¶

class pandemic_simulator.environment.interfaces.person_routine.PersonRoutine(start_loc: Optional[pandemic_simulator.environment.interfaces.ids.LocationID], end_loc: pandemic_simulator.environment.interfaces.ids.LocationID, trigger_interval: pandemic_simulator.environment.interfaces.sim_time.SimTimeInterval, trigger_hour_probability: float = 0.5, end_locs: Sequence[pandemic_simulator.environment.interfaces.ids.LocationID] = (), explore_probability: float = 0.05)[source]¶

Bases: object

A dataclass that defines a person’s routine every step (hour).

End location of the routine.

end_locs: Sequence[pandemic_simulator.environment.interfaces.ids.LocationID] = ()¶

A collection of end locations of the routine to explore.

explore_probability: float = 0.05¶

Exploration probability

start_loc: Optional[pandemic_simulator.environment.interfaces.ids.LocationID]¶

Start location of the routine. If None, the routine can be started at any location.

trigger_hour_probability: float = 0.5¶

The probability for starting the routine around the trigger interval.

trigger_interval: pandemic_simulator.environment.interfaces.sim_time.SimTimeInterval¶

A sim time interval that specifies when to start the routine.

pandemic_simulator.environment.interfaces.regulation module¶

class pandemic_simulator.environment.interfaces.regulation.PandemicRegulation(location_type_to_rule_kwargs: Optional[Dict[Type, Dict[str, Any]]] = None, business_type_to_rule_kwargs: Optional[Dict[Type, Dict[str, Any]]] = None, social_distancing: Optional[Union[float, NewType.<locals>.new_type]] = None, quarantine: bool = False, quarantine_if_contact_positive: bool = False, quarantine_if_household_quarantined: bool = False, stay_home_if_sick: bool = False, practice_good_hygiene: bool = False, wear_facial_coverings: bool = False, risk_to_avoid_gathering_size: Dict[pandemic_simulator.environment.interfaces.infection_model.Risk, int] = <factory>, risk_to_avoid_location_types: Optional[Dict[pandemic_simulator.environment.interfaces.infection_model.Risk, List[type]]] = None, stage: int = 0)[source]¶

Bases: object

Regulation passed to the Pandemic simulator that modifies the location rules and person behaviors.

business_type_to_rule_kwargs: Optional[Dict[Type, Dict[str, Any]]] = None¶

A mapping that broadcasts a generic set of rules to the locations of the same business (Essential / Non-essential) type.

location_type_to_rule_kwargs: Optional[Dict[Type, Dict[str, Any]]] = None¶

A mapping that broadcasts a generic set of rules to the locations of the same type.

practice_good_hygiene: bool = False¶

A bool to tell all persons to practice good hygiene.

quarantine: bool = False¶

A bool to tell all persons to quarantine themselves at home.

quarantine_if_contact_positive: bool = False¶

A bool to tell all persons to quarantine themselves at home if a contact is positive. Works only if contact tracing is enabled.

quarantine_if_household_quarantined: bool = False¶

A bool to tell all persons to quarantine themselves at home if a household is quarantined.

risk_to_avoid_gathering_size: Dict[pandemic_simulator.environment.interfaces.infection_model.Risk, int]¶

A mapping of the peron’s risk with the gathering size (or more) that they should avoid. -1 means no limit

risk_to_avoid_location_types: Optional[Dict[pandemic_simulator.environment.interfaces.infection_model.Risk, List[type]]] = None¶

A mapping of the peron’s risk with the locations that they should avoid.

social_distancing: Optional[Union[float, NewType.<locals>.new_type]] = None¶

A value in [0, 1] that determines how people should interact amongst each other at all locations. 1 - zero contacts, 0 - interact with everyone (impractical).

stage: int = 0¶

The discrete severity stage of the regulation. 0 - normal, severity increases with the value.

stay_home_if_sick: bool = False¶

A bool to tell all persons to stay home if sick.

wear_facial_coverings: bool = False¶

A bool to tell all persons wear facial coverings.

class pandemic_simulator.environment.interfaces.sim_time.SimTimeInterval(hour: int = 0, day: int = 0, year: int = 0, offset_hour: int = 0, offset_day: int = 0)[source]¶

Bases: object

Interval specified in hours/week_day/day/year

day: int = 0¶

Set a value in [0, 365] to indicate an interval in days

hour: int = 0¶

Set a value in [0, 23] to indicate an interval in hours.

in_hours() → int[source]¶
offset_day: int = 0¶

An offset in days [0, 365]. Example - day = 3 and offset_day = 1 would trigger once in 3 days starting a day later.

offset_hour: int = 0¶

An offset in hours [0, 23]. Example - day = 1 and offset_hour = 12 would trigger at Noon everyday.

trigger_at_interval(sim_time: pandemic_simulator.environment.interfaces.sim_time.SimTime) → bool[source]¶

Return True at sim time interval and False otherwise.

year: int = 0¶

Set a value in >0 to indicate an interval in years
